intro: Anchusa tiberiadis, commonly known as the Tiberian Anchusa, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Anchusa tiberiadis is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
